basics.benefits_moa: Venlafaxine is a serotonin and norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor (SNRI) antidepressant. It increases serotonin and norepinephrine activity in the brain, which regulate mood.
basics.bottom_line: Venlafaxine is good for treating depression and anxiety. May work when other antidepressants haven't, it's but more likely to cause side effects and withdrawal symptoms than other antidepressants.
downsides: Can cause sexual side effects like low libido and an inability to orgasm or ejaculate.
Not the best option for people with high blood pressure.
Overdosing on this medication could be fatal.
It's more likely to cause nausea and vomiting or make you feel sick if you miss a dose than other antidepressants. Also causes more sleepiness than others.
Like most antidepressants, it can cause a higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people younger than 24.
The first antidepressant you try doesn't always work or it can cause side effects you really don't like. You might need to try a few different medications until you find one that works for you.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Venlafaxine may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Venlafaxine is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

description_processed.orig: Venlafaxine may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Venlafaxine with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Venlafaxine suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1 to 2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

risks_warnings.title: High blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Venlafaxine can increase your blood pressure. Monitor your blood pressure regularly.

description_processed.orig: Venlafaxine can increase your blood pressure. Monitor your blood pressure regularly.

risks_warnings.title: Increased bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Venlafaxine can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

risks_warnings.title: Sexual dysfunction
risks_warnings.description: Venlafaxine can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

description_processed.orig: Venlafaxine can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

risks_warnings.title: Mania
risks_warnings.description: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

description_processed.orig: Paxil can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

risks_warnings.title: Mania
risks_warnings.description: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

description_processed.orig: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

risks_warnings.title: Pregnancy
risks_warnings.description: Paxil can harm a developing fetus. Don't use it while pregnant, especially in the first trimester. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

basics.benefits_moa: Clonazepam is a fast-acting benzodiazepine. It affects neurotransmitters in the brain and calms the nervous system. This reduces anxiety and muscle spasms, and causes sleepiness.
basics.bottom_line: Clonazepam is okay for occasional or short-term use (up to 4 weeks) for anxiety, and to treat seizures. Less severe withdrawal symptoms compared to similar drugs.
downsides: Can cause memory problems, drowsiness, dizziness, and confusion.
Can be habit-forming, so it's not typically used for long-term treatment, or for people who've had problems with drug or alcohol abuse.
Most people find that it gets less effective over time.

downsides_processed.orig: Can cause memory problems, drowsiness, dizziness, and confusion.

Most people find that it gets less effective over time.

upsides: Effective at relieving short-term anxiety and sleeplessness.
Can be used together with antidepressants to manage anxiety disorders. Especially helpful for anxiety symptoms while you wait for an antidepressant to kick in (it can take several weeks).
Can be used alone or with other medicines to treat seizures.
Less severe withdrawal symptoms compared to other benzodiazepines.

risks_warnings.title: Tolerance and dependence
risks_warnings.description: If you use Clonazepam for 4 weeks or more, it's likely that your body will develop tolerance to it, which means that more and more of the medication is needed to achieve the same effect. You're also likely to become physically dependent on the medication, which means that you'll feel withdrawal symptoms if you stop taking it all at once. You can avoid withdrawal by weaning off of the medication very slowly with the help of a doctor. Take only the prescribed dose to minimize risks of abuse and overdose. Clonazepam should not be used by people with a history of drug abuse if an alternative medication is available.
risk_factors: Taking more than the prescribed dose

You're also likely to become physically dependent on the medication, which means that you'll feel withdrawal symptoms if you stop taking it all at once. You can avoid withdrawal by weaning off of the medication very slowly with the help of a doctor. Take only the prescribed dose to minimize risks of abuse and overdose. Clonazepam should not be used by people with a history of drug abuse if an alternative medication is available.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Clonazepam suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and muscle pain or burning. Withdrawal symptoms can last 6 weeks or longer. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose when stopping or switching to a different medication.

Withdrawal symptoms can last 6 weeks or longer. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose when stopping or switching to a different medication.

risks_warnings.title: Pregnancy
risks_warnings.description: Clonazepam can harm a developing fetus. The baby can become dependent on the medicine and go through withdrawal after birth. Don't use Clonazepam while pregnant.

description_processed.orig: Clonazepam can harm a developing fetus. The baby can become dependent on the medicine and go through withdrawal after birth. Don't use Clonazepam while pregnant.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Clonazepam impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. These effects can extend to the morning after taking Clonazepam. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

basics.benefits_moa: Zoloft is a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) antidepressant. It increases the activity of serotonin in the brain, which regulates mood.
basics.bottom_line: Zoloft is good for treating depression and anxiety. It's more likely to cause insomnia and diarrhea than other antidepressants.
downsides: Can cause sexual side effects like low libido and an inability to orgasm or ejaculate.
More likely to cause diarrhea than other antidepressants.
Like most antidepressants, it can cause a higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people younger than 24.
The first antidepressant you try doesn't always work or it can cause side effects you really don't like. You might need to try a few different medications until you find one that works for you.

drugs.name: Zoloft

carousel_items_processed.orig: Takes about 8 to 12 weeks to see the medication's full effects on your mood.
It interacts with St. John's Wort and Tryptophan.
Stop taking it slowly to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.
Tell your doctor if you notice sudden mood changes or unusual thoughts.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Zoloft may increase risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior in children, adolescents, and young adults up to age 24. Watch for worsening depression, suicidal thoughts or behavior, or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment, or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Zoloft may increase risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior in children, adolescents, and young adults up to age 24. Watch for worsening depression, suicidal thoughts or behavior, or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment, or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Zoloft can cause a potentially life-threatening condition called serotonin syndrome when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Symptoms include agitation, sweating, muscle spasms, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, fast heart rate, fever, shaking, and hallucinations. Take the prescribed dose only, and avoid drug interactions with other medications that affect serotonin or that slow the metabolism of Zoloft.

description_processed.orig: Zoloft can cause a potentially life-threatening condition called serotonin syndrome when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Symptoms include agitation, sweating, muscle spasms, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, fast heart rate, fever, shaking, and hallucinations. Take the prescribed dose only, and avoid drug interactions with other medications that affect serotonin or that slow the metabolism of Zoloft.

risks_warnings.title: Mania
risks_warnings.description: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

risks_warnings.title: Bone fractures
risks_warnings.description: Studies have shown that Zoloft increases the risk of bone fractures. It's not known why.

description_processed.orig: Studies have shown that Zoloft increases the risk of bone fractures. It's not known why.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Withdrawal symptoms may occur if you decrease the dose or stop Zoloft suddenly. Symptoms include nausea, dizziness, muscle aches, fatigue, chills, anxiety, and irritability. Gradually reduce your dose to avoid withdrawal.

description_processed.orig: Withdrawal symptoms may occur if you decrease the dose or stop Zoloft suddenly. Symptoms include nausea, dizziness, muscle aches, fatigue, chills, anxiety, and irritability. Gradually reduce your dose to avoid withdrawal.

risks_warnings.title: Abnormal bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Zoloft may increase risk of bleeding, bruising, or bleeding in the gut. Be careful taking it with blood-thinning drugs such as warfarin, aspirin, or nonsteroidal anti-inflammatories (like ibuprofen).

description_processed.orig: Zoloft may increase risk of bleeding, bruising, or bleeding in the gut. Be careful taking it with blood-thinning drugs such as warfarin, aspirin, or nonsteroidal anti-inflammatories (like ibuprofen).

risks_warnings.title: Low sodium levels in the blood
risks_warnings.description: Zoloft may increase the risk of low sodium levels in the blood (hyponatremia). Watch out for symptoms including headache, difficulty concentrating, memory problems, confusion, weakness, and unsteadiness, which may lead to falls. Talk to a doctor right away before developing more serious symptoms, such as hallucination, fainting, coma, and death.

basics.benefits_moa: Prozac is a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) antidepressant. It increases serotonin activity in the brain, which regulates mood.
basics.bottom_line: Prozac is good for treating depression and anxiety. It's more energizing than other antidepressants, but may not be the best choice for people who have trouble sleeping.
downsides: Can cause sexual side effects like low libido and an inability to orgasm or ejaculate.
Can increase feelings of anxiety or cause headaches during the first few weeks of taking it. These effects should go away over time.
More likely than other antidepressants to interact with other medications you're taking.
Like most antidepressants, it can cause a higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people younger than 24.
The first antidepressant you try doesn't always work or it can cause side effects you really don't like. You might need to try a few different medications until you find one that works for you.

drugs.name: Prozac

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take in the morning with food to avoid side effects.
Takes about 8 to 12 weeks to see the medication's full effects on your mood.
Stop taking it slowly to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.
Tell your doctor if you notice sudden mood changes or unusual thoughts.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Prozac may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Prozac is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

description_processed.orig: Prozac may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Prozac is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Prozac with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms. Also, Prozac takes a long time to completely clear from your body. Make sure enough time is allowed to clear the medication completely before switching to another medication that affects serotonin, especially an MAO-I antidepressant.

Also, Prozac takes a long time to completely clear from your body. Make sure enough time is allowed to clear the medication completely before switching to another medication that affects serotonin, especially an MAO-I antidepressant.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Prozac suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1 to 2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1 to 2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Prozac can increase your risk of irregular heartbeat. If you have any risk factors, the maximum dose for you may be lower. Heart and blood tests may be required before starting treatment.

description_processed.orig: Prozac can increase your risk of irregular heartbeat. If you have any risk factors, the maximum dose for you may be lower. Heart and blood tests may be required before starting treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Increased bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Prozac can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

risks_warnings.title: Sexual dysfunction
risks_warnings.description: Prozac can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.
